intro: Albuca candida, commonly known as the white bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant produces a cluster of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Albuca candida is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and drought tolerance.
